BANG&JUNG&YOO&MOON

Introduction

Zelo is a South Korean rapper-songwriter under Uzu Rocks. He is a member of the boy group B.A.P and its subunit Bang & Zelo. He made his solo debut on June 21, 2019, with his first mini album "Distance."

Zelo was introduced as Bang Yongguk's sub-unit partner, Bang & Zelo, by TS Entertainment on November 24, 2011. They debuted on December 2, 2011, with their self-titled digital single.

He debuted in B.A.P on January 26, 2012, with their first single "Warrior." His contract with TS Entertainment ended in December 2018 and he chose not to renew it but did not leave the group.

On June 7, 2019, he announced his debut mini album "Distance," released on June 21, 2019. Later, on August 17, 2022, he signed an exclusive contract with Uzu Rocks.

In his personal life, Zelo announced through an Instagram post on October 15, 2023, that he would enlist in the military in December.

Fun facts

1
He got his stage name from the Greek God "Zelos" the God of Rivalry. He was given this name because of how he worked amongst his hyungs.
…
2
Zelo would practice up to 20 hours a day and still feel that it's not enough.

Zelo tends to blink a lot.

Zelo likes smart girls who are good at the things he's weak at. He also likes girls who can speak english well and also has a pretty smile.

According to Zelo, watching DBSK and Super Junior made him want to become a singer.
